intro: Khadia beswickii, commonly known as the Beswick's khadia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Western Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its distinctive umbel-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small white or pale yellow flowers bloom during the cooler months, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
